ovdesc.p: This screen is used to maintain the Bank charges(Inbound Our and Outbound Our) in the payments hub.

desc.p: Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as
Inactive by the payments hub.
Date and Time when the record was created in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
User ID of the record creator
This would be the percentage indicated in
nn.nnnn (upto 9 decimal places). If this is blank
then default percentage as defined in FeeType
table would be applied. If this is zero then no VAT
on charge would be applied even if defined in
FeeType table for the respective Fee Type.
Indicates if the payments hub needs to send 71G charges to the receiving bank or not.
Possible values:
Y - Yes.Charges are included in 71G tag
N - No.Charges are not included in 71G tag.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
Possible values:
N - Not active
A - Active
H - History
F - Future
C - Not active future
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Possible values:
L - Live
U - Unapproved
R - Reversed
Specifies if the charge defined is to be considered as Sending Bank charge or Receiving bank charge.
Possible Values:
S - Sending Bank.
R - Receiving Bank.
Indicates the code that relates to service level agreement with other banks.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.
Date and Time when the record was approved in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
User ID of the record approver
Indicates the unique bank charges ID can be linked with multiple records in this table.
Holds the Common Currency for all the fee types within a bank charge.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Holds the BIC of the sending bank.
Holds the country code of the destination.
Specifies the type of transfer for which the charge is defined.
Possible Values:
C - Customer Transfer
B - Bank Transfer
Indicates the code of the currency for which the charge is defined.
Possible Values :
Value links to field, 'CurrencyCode' in PPT.CURRENCY. Wildcard value '*' is allowed.
